intro: Willoughbya ligustrifolia, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in winter. The plant has smooth, glossy leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into woody capsules. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to coastal and sandy soils. Willoughbya ligustrifolia is also valued for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
